reasoning: Single external integration (Better Auth) with well-documented API. Database schema changes via CLI generator, ~8-10 files to create/modify. Security-sensitive but minimal attack surface due to single-user design with no public registration. The extensive PRD code samples significantly reduce implementation uncertainty.

scope.notes: Files: lib/auth.ts, lib/auth-client.ts, api/auth/[...all]/route.ts, proxy.ts, db/auth-schema.ts, db/schema modification, scripts/seed-admin.ts, app/login/page.tsx, app/office/page.tsx, .env additions. All contained within single Next.js app.

integrations.notes: Better Auth is a newer library requiring research for correct API usage. However, comprehensive code samples provided in PRD reduce research burden. React Hook Form and Zod already in project.

infrastructure.notes: Auth tables generated via @better-auth/cli. New env vars: BETTER_AUTH_SECRET, ADMIN_EMAIL, ADMIN_PASSWORD, ADMIN_NAME. Uses existing Neon Postgres database.

knowledge.notes: Drizzle ORM patterns exist in project. React Hook Form + Zod already used. Better Auth is new but PRD provides extensive implementation guidance with complete code samples.

concerns: Session management must be implemented correctly
risk.notes: Risk mitigated by: single-user design (no public registration), session-based auth (simpler than JWT), no password reset flow, Better Auth handles security internals.

validation_recommendations.reasoning: Authentication is security-sensitive code requiring comprehensive testing. Unit tests for auth config, integration tests for API routes and session handling, E2E tests for login flow. Security scan needed for auth-related code patterns. Staging not required due to single-user design and no external webhooks.
